191	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE ACQUISITION OF WASTE LAND ACT, 1950 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p align="center"><strong>THE ACQUISITION OF WASTE LAND ACT, 1950</strong></p><p align="center">(EAST BENGAL ACT NO. XIX OF 1950)</p><p align="right">[18th May, 1950]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to provide for the acquisition for public purposes of waste land in Bangladesh.   1</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the acquisition for public purposes of waste land in Bangladesh;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Short title and extent </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the 2[ * * *] Acquisition of Waste Land Act, 1950.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh except any area constituted a municipality under the provisions of 3[ the Paurashava Ordinance, 1977 (XXVI of 1977)].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(1)        “Collector” includes Deputy Commissioner and such other officers as may be authorised by the Government to perform all or any of the functions of a Collector under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2)        “waste land” means any land including marshy tracts, water courses, and jungle areas, which has not grown any crop for five consecutive years or more immediately preceding the date of publication of the notification</p><p style="text-align: justify;">under section 3 in respect of such land, but does not include-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         any land which has been acquired before such date or has been held from before such date for industrial or building purposes or for the purposes of trade or business;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        any land which has been held from before such date for purposes connected with the cultivation or manufacture of tea;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       any land used for homestead purposes together with any garden appertaining to a homestead;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3)        “person interested” includes all persons claiming an interest in compensation to be made on account of the acquisition of any land under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4)        “public purpose” includes,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the production of food; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the afforestation of land; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the carrying out of irrigation or drainage schemes; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d) the provision of sites for the setting up of model villages; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the reclamation of land for bringing it under cultivation; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) the settlement of land with any person or persons, in order to provide them with a means of livelihood or with holdings of an economic size or in order to enable such person or persons to carry on large scale farming on a co-operative basis or otherwise by the use of power-driven mechanical appliances;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Publication of preliminary notification and powers of officers on the issue of such notification</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. (1) Whenever it appears to the Government that any waste land (hereinafter in this Act referred to as land) is needed or is likely to be needed for any public purpose, a notification to that effect shall be published in the official Gazette, and the Collector shall cause public notice of the substance of such notification to be given at convenient places on or near the land.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Thereupon it shall be lawful for any officer either generally or specially authorised by the Government in this behalf, and for his servants and workmen,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        to enter upon and survey and take levels of the land;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to dig or bore into the sub-soil;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to do all other acts necessary to ascertain whether the land is adapted for such purpose;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        to set out the boundaries of the land proposed to be taken and the intended line of the work (if any) proposed to be made thereon;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        to mark such levels, boundaries and line by placing marks and cutting trenches;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) and where otherwise the survey cannot be completed and the levels taken and the boundaries and line marked, to cut down and clear away any fence or jungle.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Objections</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. (1) Any person interested in any land which has been notified under sub-section (1) of section 3, as being needed or likely to be needed for a public purpose, may, within fifteen days after the issue of the notification, object to the acquisition of the land.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every objection under sub-section (1) shall be made to the Collector in writing, and the Collector shall, after giving the objector an opportunity of being heard and after making such inquiry, if any, as he thinks necessary, submit the case for the decision of the Government together with the record of the proceedings held by him and a report containing his recommendations on the objections. The decision of the Government on the objections shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) For the purpose of this section, a person shall be deemed to be interested in land who would be entitled to claim an interest in compensation if the land were acquired under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Declaration that land is required for a public purpose</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) When the Government is satisfied, after considering the report, if any, made under sub-section (2) of section (4), that the land is needed for a public purpose, a declaration shall be made to that effect under the signature of a Secretary to 4[ the] Government or of some officers duly authorised to certify its orders.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The declaration shall be published in the official Gazette, and shall state the district or other territorial division in which the land is situated, the purpose for which it is needed, its approximate area, and, where a plan shall have been made of the land, the place where such plan may be inspected.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The said declaration shall be conclusive evidence that the land is needed for a public purpose and after making such declaration, the Government may acquire the land in the manner hereinafter appearing.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Order for acquisition</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. Whenever any land shall have been so declared to be needed for a public purpose, the Government, or some officers authorised by the Government in this behalf, shall direct the Collector to take order for the acquisition of the land.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Notice to persons interested</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) The Collector shall then cause public notice to be given at convenient places on or near the land to be taken, stating that the Government intends to take possession of the land, and that claims to compensation for all interests in such land may be made to him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Such notice shall state the particulars of the land so needed, and shall require all persons interested in the land to appear personally or by agent before the Collector at a time and place therein mentioned (such time not being earlier than fifteen days after the date of publication of the notice), and to state the nature of their respective interests in the land and the amount and particulars of their claims to compensation for such interests, and their objections (if any) to the measurements of the land. The Collector may in any case require such statement to be made in writing and signed by the party or his agent.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Collector shall also serve notice to the same effect on the occupier (if any) of such land and on all such persons known or believed to be interested therein as reside or have agents authorised to receive service on their behalf, within the district in which the land is situated.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) In case any person so interested resides elsewhere, and has no such agent, the notice shall be sent to him at his last known residence, address or place of business.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Power to require and enforce the making of statements as to names and interests</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) The Collector may also require any such person to make or deliver to him, at a time and place mentioned (such time not being earlier than fifteen days after the date of the requisition), a statement containing, so far as may be practicable, the name of every other person possessing any interest in the land or any part thereof as co-proprietor, tenure-holder, mortgagee, tenant or otherwise, the nature of such interest and the rents and profits (if any) received or receivable on account thereof for three years next preceding the date of the statement.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every person required to make or deliver a statement under this section or section 7 shall be deemed to be legally bound to do so within the meaning of sections 175 and 176 of the 5[ * * *] Penal Code.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Power to take possession</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. At any time after the expiration of fifteen days from the publication of the notice mentioned in sub-section (1) of section 7, the Collector may take possession of the land, which shall thereupon vest absolutely in the Government free from all encumbrances.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Enquiry and award by Collector</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. (1) On the day fixed under sub-section (2) of section 7 or on any other day to which the enquiry has been adjourned, the Collector shall proceed to enquire into the objections (if any) which any person interested has stated pursuant to a notice given under section 7 to the measurements of the land and into the respective interests of the persons claiming the compensation and the amount and particulars of their claims, and shall make an award under his hand of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the true area of the land;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        the compensation which in his opinion should be allowed under section 12; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       the apportionment of the said compensation among all the persons known or believed to be interested in the land, of whom, or of whose claims, he has information, whether or not they have respectively appeared before him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Such award shall be filed in the Collector's office and shall, except as hereinafter provided, be final and conclusive evidence as between the Collector and the persons interested, whether they have respectively appeared before the Collector or not, of the true area and value of the land the apportionment of the compensation among the persons interested.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Collector shall give immediate notice of his award to such of the persons interested as are not present personally or by their representatives when the award is made.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Power to summon and enforce attendance of witnesses and production of documents</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11.       For the purpose of enquiries under this Act the Collector shall have power to summon and enforce the attendance of witnesses, including the parties interested or any of them, and to compel the production of documents by the same means, and so far as may be in the same manner, as is provided in the case of a Civil Court under the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Principles of determining compensation</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12.       In determining the amount of compensation the Collector shall be guided by the following provisions, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        if the land does not yield any income, the immediate owner of the land shall receive compensation at the rate of rupees ten per acre;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        if the land yields any income, the immediate owner of the land shall get compensation of an amount equivalent to five times the net annual income to be determined in the manner prescribed or ten times the annual rent paid by occupancy raiyats for an equal area of cultivated land in the neighbourhood which the Collector may select as being appropriate for the purpose, whichever is greater;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        in either case, the superior landlords shall get compensation of an amount equivalent to ten times their respective net annual incomes from such land determined in the prescribed manner on the basis of the rental value of such land.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Apportionment of compensation</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13.       (1) Where there are several persons interested, if such persons agree to the apportionment of the compensation, the particulars of such apportionment shall be specified in the award, and as between such persons the award shall be conclusive evidence of the correctness of the apportionment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) When the amount of compensation has been settled under section 10, if any dispute arises as to the apportionment of the same or any part thereof or as to the persons to whom the same or any part thereof is payable, the Collector shall decide such dispute subject to rules made under this Act before making the award under sub-section (1) of that section.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Special powers in cases of urgency</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14.       In cases of urgency, the Government may direct that the provisions of section 4 shall not apply, and, if it does not direct, a declaration may be made under section 5 in respect of the land at any time after the publication of the notification under sub-section (1) of section 3.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Appeal</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15.       (1) Any person interested who has not accepted the award made by the Collector or the decision of the Collector regarding the amount of compensation payable under sub-section (2) of section 24 may, in the manner prescribed, prefer an appeal, within six weeks of the date of such award or decision, to the prescribed authority whether his objection be to the measurement of the land, the amount of the compensation, the persons to whom it is payable or the apportionment of the compensation among the persons interested or the decision under sub-section (2) of section 24.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The decision of the prescribed authority shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Bar to jurisdiction of Civil Courts</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16.       No Civil Court shall entertain any suit in respect of any matter arising out of any proceedings under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Modification of the award according to the decision of the appellate authority</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. When all appeals under section 15 against the award of the Collector have been disposed of, the decisions of the appellate authority together with the records of the cases shall be forwarded to the Collector who shall thereupon modify the award according to such decisions.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Payment of compensation</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. The compensation awarded shall be paid by the Collector subject to such rules as may be made in this behalf under this Act:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that nothing contained in this Act or in any rules made thereunder shall affect the liability of any person who may receive the whole or any part of any compensation awarded under this Act to pay the same to the person lawfully entitled thereto.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Investment of money awarded in respect of land belonging to person incompetent to alienate</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19.       (1) If the land, in respect of which any money is awarded, belonged to any person who had no power to alienate the same, it shall be kept in deposit with the Collector and be invested in such manner as the Collector thinks fit; and the person or persons who would for the time being have been entitled to the possession of the said land shall be entitled to receive the interest or other proceeds arising from such investment and the said money shall remain so deposited and invested until the same be applied in payment to any person or persons becoming absolutely entitled thereto.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In all cases of moneys deposited to which this section applies, the cost of such investment including all reasonable charges and expenses incidental thereto and such other costs as may be prescribed shall be paid by the Collector.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Payment of interest</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20.       When the amount of compensation awarded is not paid, or is not deposited under sub-section (1) of section 19, on or before the date on which possession is taken of the land, the Collector shall when paying or depositing such amount also pay or deposit, as the case may be, interest thereon at the rate of three per centum per annum from such date until the date on which such amount is paid or so deposited:</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that such interest shall not be payable in the case where the persons entitled to the amount of compensation do not consent to receive it or where there is any dispute as to the title to receive it or as to its apportionment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Service of notices</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21.       The service of any notice under this Act shall be made in the manner prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Penalty for obstructing acquisition of land</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22.       Whoever wilfully obstructs any person in doing any of the acts authorised by section 3 or wilfully fills up, destroys, damages or displaces any trench or mark made under section 3, shall, on conviction before a Magistrate, be liable to imprisonment for any term not exceeding one month, or to a fine not exceeding fifty rupees or to both.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Magistrate to enforce surrender</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23.       If the Collector is opposed or impeded in taking possession under this Act of any land, he shall, if a Magistrate, enforce the surrender of the land to himself, and if not a Magistrate, he shall apply to a Magistrate and such Magistrate shall enforce the surrender of the land to the Collector.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Completion of acquisition not compulsory</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24.       (1) The Government shall be at liberty to withdraw at any time from the acquisition of any land, before the award has been made under section 10.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Whenever the Government withdraws from any such acquisition, the Collector shall determine the amount of compensation due for the damages, if any, suffered by the owner in consequence of the notice or of any proceedings thereunder, and shall pay such amount to the person interested, together with all costs reasonably incurred by him in the prosecution of the proceedings under this Act relating to the said land.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Exemption from stamp-duty and fees</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25.       No award made under this Act shall be chargeable with stamp-duty, and no person claiming under any such award shall be liable to pay any fee for a copy of the same.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Protection of action taken under the Act</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">26.       (1) No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against any person for anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done in pursuance of this Act or any rules made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Save as otherwise expressly provided under this Act, no suit or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Government for any damage caused or likely to be caused by anything in good faith done or intended to be done in pursuance of this Act or any rules made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Power to make rules</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">27.       (1) The Government may make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In particular and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the determination of net annual income under clauses (b) and (c) of section 12;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the decision of disputes under sub-section (2) of section 13 as to the apportionment of compensation;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the manner of preferring appeals under section 15, and the authority to whom such appeals are to be preferred;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the payment of compensation referred to in section 18;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) the costs other than the costs of investment of the compensation money referred to in sub-section (2) of section 19;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) the manner of service of notices under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">___________________________________________________________</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 Throughout this Act, the words “Bangladesh” and “Government” were substituted for the words “East Pakistan” and “Provincial Government” respectively by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">2 The words “East Bengal” were omitted by Article 6 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3 The words, comma, brackets and figures “the Paurashava Ordinance, 1977 (Ordinance No. XXVI of 1977)” were substituted for the words, comma and figures “the Municipal Administration Ordinance, 1960” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">4 The word “the” was substituted for the word “such” by section 3 and the Second Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5 The word “Pakistan” was omitted by Article 6 of the Bangladesh (Adaptation of Existing Laws) Order, 1972 (President's Order No. 48 of 1972)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">Source : Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p> </div></div>
192	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE AIR FORCE ACT, 1953   </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p align="center"><b>THE AIR FORCE ACT, 1953</b></p><p align="center">(ACT NO. VI OF 1953)</p><p align="right">[15th April, 1953]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to the government and discipline of the Bangladesh Air Force.            1 2 3</p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to consolidate and amend the law relating to the government and discipline of the Bangladesh Air Force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p align="center"><b>CHAPTER I</b></p><p align="center">PRELIMINARY</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Short title and commencement</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the 4[ * * *] Air Force Act, 1953.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification, appoint in this behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Persons subject to this Act</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. The following persons shall be subject to this Act wherever they may be, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        5[ officers, master warrant officers and] warrant officers of the Air Force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        persons enrolled under the 6[ * * *] Air Force Act, 1932, before the date notified in pursuance of sub-section (2) of section 1 and serving in the Air Force on that date, and persons enrolled under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        persons belonging to the Bangladesh Air Force Reserves in the circumstances prescribed by rules made under section 6 of the 7[ Army and Air Force Reserves Act, 1950];</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        persons not otherwise subject to Air Force law who on active service, in camp, on the march, or at any frontier post specified by the Government, by notification in this behalf, are employed by, or are in the service of, or are followers of, or accompany any portion of, the Air Force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">8[ (dd) persons not otherwise subject to Air Force law who are accused of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         seducing or attempting to seduce any person subject to this Act from his duty or allegiance to Government, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        having committed, in relation to any work of defence, arsenal, naval, military or air force establishment or station, ship or aircraft or otherwise in relation to the naval, military or air force affairs of Bangladesh, an offence under the Official Secrets Act, 1923.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) to such extent and subject to such conditions as the Government may direct, persons subject to the 9[ * * *] Army Act, 1952 (XXXIX of 1952), or the 10[ * * *] Navy Ordinance, 1961 (XXXV of 1961), when seconded for service with the Air Force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Termination of application of the Act</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. Every person subject to this Act under clauses (a) to (c) of section 2 shall remain so subject until duly retired, discharged, released, removed or dismissed from the service and every person subject to this Act under clause (e) of section 2 shall remain so subject during the period of his secondment to the Air Force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Secondment to Army or Navy</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11[ 3A. The Government may by order in writing direct that any person referred to in clause (a), clause (b), clause (c) or clause (d) of section 2 shall, under such conditions as may be specified by regulations, be seconded for service with the Bangladesh Army or the Bangladesh Navy.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Definitions</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">4. In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         “active service”, as applied to a person subject to this Act, means the time during which such person-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        is attached to, or forms part of, a force which is engaged in operations against an enemy, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        is engaged in Air Force operations in, or is on the line of march to, a country or place wholly or partly occupied by an enemy, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        is attached to, or forms part of, a force which is in military occupation of any foreign country;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        “aircraft” includes aeroplanes, balloons, kite balloons, airships, gliders or other machines for flying;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       “aircraft material” includes any engines, fittings, guns, gear, instruments or apparatus for use in connection with aircraft, and any of its components and accessories and petrol, oil, and any other substance used for providing motive power for planes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       “Air Force” means officers, 12[ master warrant officers, warrant officers] and airmen who by their commission, junior commission, terms of enrolment or otherwise, are liable to render continuously for a term air force service to Bangladesh in every part of the world or any specified part of the world, including persons belonging to the Bangladesh Air Force Reserves when called up for training or exercise or into actual service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v)        “Air Force custody” means the arrest or confinement of a person according to the usages of the service and includes military or naval custody;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vi)       “Air Force law” means the law enacted by this Act and the rules made thereunder and includes the usages of the service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(vii)      “Air Force reward” includes any gratuity or annuity for long service or good conduct, badge pay or pension, and any other Air Force pecuniary reward;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(viii) “airman” means any person subject to this Act other than an officer 13[ or a master warrant officer or a warrant officer];</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ix)       “air officer” means any officer of the Air Force above the rank of group captain;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(x)        “air signal” means any signal intended for the guidance of aircraft, whether given by flag, ground signal, light, wind indicator or in any manner whatsoever;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xi)       “civil offence” means an offence which is triable by a criminal court;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xii)      “civil prison” means any jail or place used for the detention of any criminal prisoner under the Prisons Act, 1894, or under any other law for the time being in force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xiii) “Chief of Air Staff” means the Officer Chief of Air Staff the Air Force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xiv) “commanding officer” used in relation to a person subject to this Act, means the officer prescribed as commanding officer for the purpose of all or any of the provisions of this Act, or in the absence of any such prescription, the officer for the time being in command of the unit or detachment to which such person belongs or is attached;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xv)      “court-martial” means a court-martial held under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xvi) “criminal court” means a court of ordinary criminal justice in any part of Bangladesh or established elsewhere by the authority of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xvii) “enemy” includes all armed mutineers, armed rebels, armed rioters, pirates and any person in arms against whom it is the duty of any person subject to naval, military or Air Force law to act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xviii) “the Forces” means the regular Army, Navy and Air Force or any part or parts of any one or more of them;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">14[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xx)      “Judge Advocate General” means a person appointed as such by the Chief of Air Staff to give advice on matters relating to Air Force law and to perform such other duties of a legal character as may arise in connection therewith;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">15[ (xxa) “master warrant officer” means a person commissioned, gazetted or in pay as a master warrant officer of the Air Force and includes an acting master warrant officer, and a master warrant officer of the Bangladesh Air Force Volunteer Reserve who is for the time being subject to this Act;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxi) “non-commissioned officer” means a person holding a non-commissioned rank or an acting non-commissioned rank in the Air Force, and includes any person holding a non-commissioned rank or an acting non-commissioned rank in the Bangladesh Air Force Volunteer Reserve when subject to this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxii) “notification” means a notification published in the official Gazette;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxiii) “offence” means any act or omission punishable under this Act, and includes a civil offence, as hereinbefore defined;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxiv) “officer” means a person commissioned, gazetted or in the pay as an officer in the Air Force and includes-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) an officer of the Bangladesh Air Force Voluntary Reserve who is for the time being subject to this Act; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        an officer of the Bangladesh Army or the Bangladesh Navy when serving under the prescribed conditions;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">but does not include a junior commissioned officer, 16[ master warrant officer, warrant officer], petty officer or non-commissioned officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxv) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxvi) “provost-marshal” means a person appointed as such under this Act and includes any of his deputies or assistants or any other person legally exercising authority under him or on his behalf;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxvii) “regulation” includes a regulation made under this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxviii) “service” when qualifying institution, necessaries, books, band, mess, money, goods and other property, means belonging to or connected with the air service or any unit or part of a unit thereof;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxix) “superior officer” when used in relation to a person subject to this Act, includes a warrant officer and a non-commissioned officer, and as regards persons serving under such conditions as may be prescribed, an officer, junior commissioned officer, 17[ master warrant officer, warrant officer], petty officer and non-commissioned officer of the regular Army or the Navy;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxx) “unit” includes-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        any body of officers and airmen or of officers, 18[ master warrant officers, warrant officers] and airmen for which a separate authorised establishment exists;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        any separate body of persons subject to this Act employed on any service and not attached to a unit as aforesaid;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) any other separate body of persons composed wholly or partly of persons subject to this Act, and specified as a unit by the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxxi)    “warrant officer” means a person commissioned, gazetted or in pay as a warrant officer of the Air Force and includes an acting warrant officer, and a warrant officer of the Bangladesh Air Force Volunteer Reserve who is for the time being subject to this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(xxxii) all words and expressions used herein and defined in the 19[ Penal Code] and not hereinbefore defined, shall be deemed to have the meanings respectively assigned to them by that Code.</p><p align="center">CHAPTER II</p><p align="center">SPECIAL PROVISIONS FOR THE APPLICATION OF ACT IN CERTAIN CASES</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Application of Act to certain forces under the Government</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The Government may, by notification, apply, with or without modifications, all or any of the provisions of this Act to any force raised and maintained in Bangladesh and suspend the operation of any other enactment for the time being applicable to the said force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The provisions of this Act so applied shall have effect in respect of persons belonging to the said force as they have effect in respect of persons subject to this Act holding in the Air Force the same or equivalent rank as the aforesaid persons hold for the time being in the said force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The provisions of this Act so applied shall also have effect in respect of persons who are employed by, or are in the service of, or are followers of, or accompany any portion of the said force as they have effect in respect of persons subject to this Act under clause (d) of section 2.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) While any of the provisions of this Act apply to the said force, the Government may, by notification, direct by what authority any jurisdiction, powers or duties incident to the operation of these provisions shall be exercised or performed in respect of the said force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Special provision as to rank in certain cases</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">6. (1) The Government may, by notification, direct that any persons or class of persons subject to this Act under clause (d) of section 2, shall be so subject as officers, 20[ master warrant officer,] warrant officers or non-commissioned officers, and may authorise any officer to give a like direction or to cancel such direction.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) All persons subject to this Act other than officers, warrant officers and non-commissioned officers, shall, if they are not persons in respect of whom a notification or direction under sub-section (1) is in force, be deemed to be of a rank 21[ lower] to that of a non-commissioned officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Commanding officers of persons subject to Air Force law under clause (d) of section 2</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">7. (1) Every person subject to this Act, under clause (d) of section 2 shall for the purposes of this Act, be deemed to be under the commanding officer of the unit, or detachment, if any, to which he is attached, or if he is not so attached, under the command of any officer who may for the time being be named as his commanding officer by the officer commanding the force with which such person may for the time being be serving, or of any other prescribed officer, or if no such officer is named or prescribed, under the command of the said officer commanding the force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) An officer commanding a force shall not place a person subject to this Act under clause (d) of section 2 under the command of an officer of official rank 22[ lower] to that of such person if there is present at the place where such person is any officer of higher rank under whose command he can be placed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Officers exercising powers in certain cases</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">8. (1) Whenever persons subject to this Act are serving whether within or without Bangladesh under an officer not subject to this Act, the Government may prescribe the officer by whom the powers which, under this Act, may be exercised by officers commanding units, shall, as regards such persons, be exercised.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Government may confer such powers either absolutely or subject to such restrictions, reservations, exceptions and conditions as it may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Exercise of powers vested in holder of Air Force office</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">9. Any power or jurisdiction given to, and any act or thing to be done by, to, or before any person holding any Air Force appointment may be exercised by, or done by, to, or before any other person for the time being authorised in that behalf according to the custom of the service, or according to rules made under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Power to declare persons to be on active service</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10. Notwithstanding anything contained in clause (i) of section 4, the Government may, by notification, declare that any persons or class of persons subject to this Act, shall, with reference to any area in which they may be serving or with reference to any provision of this Act or of any other law for the time being in force, be deemed to be on active service within the meaning of this Act.</p><p align="center">CHAPTER III</p><p align="center">COMMISSION, APPOINTMENT AND ENROLMENT</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Commission and appointment</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11. The President may grant to such person as he thinks fit a commission as an officer or a junior commission as a 23[ master warrant officer or a warrant officer] of the Air Force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Ineligibility of aliens for enrolment</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24[ 12. No person who is not a citizen of Bangladesh shall, except with the consent of the Government signified in writing, be granted a Commission or junior commission or be enrolled in the Air Force.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Procedure before enrolling officer</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13. Upon the appearance before the prescribed enrolling officer of any person desirous of being enrolled, the enrolling officer shall read and explain to him, or cause to be read and explained to him in his presence, the conditions of the service for which he is to be enrolled; and shall put to him the questions set forth in the prescribed form of enrolment, and shall, after having cautioned him that if he makes a false answer to any such question he will be liable to punishment under this Act, record or cause to be recorded his answer to each such question.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Mode of enrolment</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14. If, after complying with the provisions of section 13, the enrolling officer is satisfied that the person desirous of being enrolled fully understands the questions put to him and consents to the conditions of service, and if such officer perceives no impediment, he shall sign and shall also cause such person to sign the enrolment paper, and such person shall thereupon be deemed to be enrolled.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Validity of enrolment</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15. Every person who has for the space of three months been in receipt of pay as a person enrolled under this Act and been borne on the rolls of any unit shall be deemed to have been duly enrolled and shall not be entitled to claim his discharge on the ground of any irregularity or illegality in his enrolment or on any other ground whatsoever; and if any person in receipt of such pay and borne on the rolls as aforesaid claims his discharge before the expiry of three months from his enrolment, no such irregularity or illegality or other ground shall, until he is discharged in pursuance of his claim, affect his position as an enrolled person under this Act or invalidate any proceedings, act or thing taken or done prior to his discharge.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Persons to be attested</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">16. The following persons shall be attested, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        all persons enrolled as combatants;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        all other persons subject to this Act as may be prescribed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Mode of attestation</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">17. (1) When a person who is to be attested is reported fit for duty, or has completed the prescribed period of probation, an oath or affirmation shall be administered to him in the prescribed form by his commanding officer in front of his unit or such portion thereof as may be present, or by any other prescribed person.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The form of oath or affirmation prescribed under this section shall contain a promise that the person to be attested will be faithful to Bangladesh and its Constitution and bear true allegiance to the President of Bangladesh and that he will honestly and faithfully serve in the Air Force and go wherever he is ordered by land, sea or air and that he will obey all commands of any officer set over him, even to the peril of his life.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The fact of an enrolled person having taken the oath or affirmation directed by this section to be taken shall be entered on his enrolment paper, and authenticated by the signature of the officer administering the oath or affirmation.</p><p align="center">CHAPTER IV</p><p align="center">CONDITIONS OF SERVICE</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Tenure of service under the Act</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">18. Every person subject to this Act shall hold office during the pleasure of the President.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Termination of service by Government</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">19. Subject to the provisions of this Act and the rules and regulations made thereunder, the Government may dismiss or remove from the service any person subject to this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Dismissal, removal or reduction by Commander of Air Staff or other officers</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">20. (1) The Chief of Air Staff, or any officer, empowered in this behalf under the rules may at any time dismiss or remove from the service any person subject to this Act other than an officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chief of Air Staff or any officer empowered in this behalf under the rules may reduce to a lower grade, or to a lower rank or to the ranks, any non-commissioned officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chief of Air Staff or any officer empowered in this behalf under the rules may reduce to a lower class in the ranks any airman other than a non-commissioned officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The commanding officer of an acting non-commissioned officer may order him to revert to his substantive rank as a non-commissioned officer, or if he has no substantive rank, to the ranks.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) On active service, an officer commanding the air forces in the field may reduce to a lower rank or to the ranks any non-commissioned officer under his command.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) The exercise of any powers under this section shall be subject to the other provisions contained in this Act, and the rules and regulations made thereunder.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Retirement, release or discharge</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">21. Any person subject to this Act may be retired, released or discharged from the service by such authority and in such manner as may be prescribed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Certificate on termination of service</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22. Every warrant officer, or enrolled person who is dismissed, removed, discharged, retired or released from the service shall be furnished by his commanding officer with a certificate setting forth-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the authority terminating his service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the cause for such termination; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the full period of his service in the Air Force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Discharge or dismissal when out of Bangladesh</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">23. (1) Any person enrolled under this Act who is entitled under the conditions of his enrolment to be discharged, or whose discharge is ordered by a competent authority, and who, when he is so entitled or ordered to be discharged, is serving out of Bangladesh, and requests to be sent to Bangladesh, shall, before being discharged, be sent to Bangladesh with all convenient speed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person enrolled under this Act who is dismissed from the service and who, when he is so dismissed, is serving out of Bangladesh, shall be sent to Bangladesh with all convenient speed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where any such person as is mentioned in sub-section (2) is sentenced to dismissal combined with any other punishment, such other punishment, or, in the case of a sentence of imprisonment or detention, a portion of such sentence, may be inflicted before he is sent to Bangladesh.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) For the purposes of this section, the word “discharge” includes release, and the word “dismissal” includes removal.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Power to modify certain fundamental rights in their application to persons subject to this Act</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. Subject to the provisions of any law for the time being in force relating to the Air Force or to any branch thereof, the Government may, by notification, make rules restricting in such manner and to such extent as may be specified the right of any person subject of this Act-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) to be a member of, or to be associated in any way with, any trade union or labour union, or any class of trade or labour union or any society, institution or association, or any class of societies, institutions or associations;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        to attend or address any meeting or to take part in any demonstration organised by any body of persons for any political or other purposes;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        to communicate with the press or to publish or cause to be published any book, letter or other document.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER V</p><p style="text-align: justify;">SERVICE PRIVILEGES</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Authorised deductions only to be made from pay</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">25. The pay and allowances of every person subject to this Act due to him as such under any regulation for the time being in force, shall be paid without any deduction other than the deductions authorised by or under this or any other Act, or prescribed by the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Remedy of aggrieved warrant officers and airmen</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">26. (1) Any Master warrant officer or warrant officer or airman who deems himself wronged by any superior or other officer may, if not attached to a unit or detachment, complain to the officer under whose command or order he is serving; and may, if attached to a unit or detachment, complain to the officer commanding the same.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) When the officer complained against is the officer to whom any complaint should, under sub-section (1) be preferred, the aggrieved 25[ master warrant officer or] warrant officer or airman may complain to such officer's next superior officer, and if he thinks himself wronged by such superior officer, he may complain to the Chief of Air Staff.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Every officer receiving any such complaint shall make as complete an investigation into it as may be possible for giving full redress to the complainant; or when necessary, refer the complaint to a superior authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Every such complaint shall be preferred in such manner as may from time to time be specified by the proper authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Government may revise any decision by the Chief of Air Staff under sub-section (2), but subject thereto, the decision of the Chief of Air Staff shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Remedy of aggrieved officers</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">27. Any officer who deems himself wronged by his commanding officer or any superior officer, and who on due application made to his commanding officer, does not receive the redress to which he considers himself entitled, may complain to the Government in such manner as may from time to time be specified by the proper authority.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Immunity from attachment</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">28. The arms, clothes, equipment, accoutrement or necessaries of any person subject to this Act shall not be seized, and the pay and allowances of any such person or any part thereof shall not be attached, by direction of any civil or revenue court or any revenue officer, in satisfaction of any decree or order enforceable against him.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Immunity from arrest for debt</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. (1) No person subject to this Act shall so long as he belongs to the Air Force, be liable to be arrested for debt under any process issued by, or by the authority of, any civil or revenue court or revenue officer.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The judge of any such court or the said officer may examine into any complaint made by such person or his superior officer of the arrest of such person contrary to the provisions of this section, and may by warrant under his hand, discharge the person, and award reasonable costs to the complainant, who may recover these costs in like manner as he might have recovered costs awarded to him by a decree against the person obtaining the process.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) For the recovery of such costs no court-fee shall be payable by the complainant.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Immunity of persons attending courts-martial from arrest</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">30. (1) No president or member of a court-martial, no judge advocate, no party to any proceeding before a court-martial, or his legal practitioner or agent, and no witness acting in obedience to a summons to attend a court-martial, shall, while proceeding to, attending, or returning from a court-martial, be liable to arrest by civil or revenue process.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If any such person is arrested under any such process, he may be discharged by order of the court-martial.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Privileges of reservists</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">31. Every person belonging to the Air Force Reserve shall, when called out for, or engaged in, or returning from training or service, be entitled to all the privileges accorded by sections 28 and 29 to a person subject to this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Priority in respect of Air Force personnel’s litigation</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">32. (1) On the presentation to any court by or on behalf of any person subject to this Act of a certificate, from the proper Air Force authority, of leave of absence having been granted to or applied for by him for the purpose of prosecuting or defending any suit or other proceeding in such court, the court shall, on the application of such person, arrange, so far as may be possible, for the hearing and final disposal of such suit or other proceeding within the period of the leave so granted or applied for.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The certificate from the proper Air Force authority shall state the first and last day of the leave or intended leave, and set forth a description of the case with respect to which the leave was granted or applied for.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) No fee shall be payable to the court in respect of the presentation of any such certificate or of any application by or on behalf of any such person for priority for the hearing of his case.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Where the court is unable to arrange for the hearing and final disposal of the suit or other proceeding within the period of such leave or intended leave as aforesaid, it shall record its reasons for its inability to do so, and shall cause a copy thereof to be furnished to such person on his application without any payment whatever by him in respect either of the application for such copy or of the copy itself.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) If in any case a question arises as to the proper Air Force authority qualified to grant such certificate as aforesaid, such question shall be at once referred by the court to an officer, commanding an Air Force station or a superior Air Force authority whose decision shall be final.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Saving of rights and privileges under other laws</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">33. The rights and privileges specified in the preceding sections of this Chapter shall be in addition to any others conferred on persons subject to this Act or on members of the regular Army, Navy and Air Force generally by any other law for the time being in force.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER VI</p><p style="text-align: justify;">OFFENCES</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Offences in relation to the enemy and punishable with death</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">34. Any person subject to this Act, who commits any of the following offences, that is to say:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        shamefully abandons or delivers up any garrison, fortress, post, place or guard, committed to his charge, or which it is his duty to defend, or uses any means to compel or induce any commanding officer or other person to commit the said act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        intentionally uses any means to compel or induce any person subject to Military, Naval or Air Force law to abstain from acting against the enemy, or to discourage such person from acting against the enemy; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        in the presence of the enemy shamefully casts away his arms, ammunition, tools or equipment or misbehaves in such manner as to show cowardice; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        treacherously holds correspondence with, or communicates intelligence to, the enemy or any person in arms against Bangladesh; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        directly or indirectly assists the enemy with money, arms, ammunition, stores or supplies; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         treacherously or through cowardice sends a flag of truce to the enemy; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        in time of war or during any Air Force operation, intentionally occasions a false alarm in action, camp or quarters or spreads reports calculated to create alarm or despondency; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        in time of action leaves his commanding officer or his post, guard, piquet, patrol or party without being regularly relieved or without leave; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         having been made a prisoner of war, voluntarily serves with or aids the enemy; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         knowingly harbours or protects an enemy not being a prisoner; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        being a sentry in time of war or alarm, sleeps upon his post or is intoxicated; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l)         knowingly does any act calculated to imperil the success of the Military, Naval or Air Forces of Bangladesh or any forces co-operating therewith or any part of such forces; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(m)       treacherously or shamefully causes the capture or destruction by the enemy of any aircraft belonging to the Government; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n)        treacherously uses any false air signal or alters or interferes with any air signal; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o)        when ordered by his superior officer or otherwise under orders to carry out any Air Force operations, treacherously or shamefully fails to use his utmost exertions to carry such orders into effect;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer death.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Offences in relation to the enemy and not punishable with death</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">35. Any person subject to this Act who commits any of the following offences, that is to say:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        is taken prisoner, by want of due precaution, or through disobedience of orders, or wilful neglect of duty, or having been taken prisoner, fails to rejoin his service when able to do so; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        without due authority holds correspondence with or communicates intelligence to the enemy; or having come by the knowledge of any such correspondence or communication wilfully omits to discover it immediately to his commanding or other superior officer; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        without due authority sends flag of truce to the enemy; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        negligently causes the capture or destruction by the enemy of any aircraft belonging to the Government; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        when ordered by his superior officer, or otherwise under orders to carry out any warlike operations in the air, negligently or through other default fails to use his utmost exertions to carry such orders into effect;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer long imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Offences punishable more severely on active service than at other terms</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">36. Any person subject to this Act who commits any of the following offences, that is to say:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        forces a safeguard, or forces or uses criminal force to a sentry; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        breaks into any house or other place in search of plunder; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        being a sentry sleeps upon his post, or is intoxicated; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        without orders from his superior officer leaves his guard, piquet, patrol or post ; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        intentionally or through neglect occasions a false alarm in camp or quarters; or spreads reports calculated to create unnecessary alarm or despondency; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         makes known the parole, watchword or countersign to any person not entitled to receive it; or knowingly gives a parole, watchword or countersigns different from what he received ; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        without due authority alters or interferes with any air signal;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">if he commits any such offence when on active service, be liable to suffer long imprisonment; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">if he commits any such offence when not on active service, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Mutiny</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">37. Any person subject to this Act who commits any of the following offences, that is to say:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        begins, incites, causes, or conspires with any other person to cause, any mutiny in the Military, Naval or Air Forces of Bangladesh or any forces co-operating therewith; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        joins in any such mutiny; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        being present at any such mutiny, does not use his utmost endeavours to suppress the same; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        knowing or having reason to believe in the existence of any such mutiny, or of any intention to commit such mutiny or any such conspiracy, does not, without delay, give information thereof to his commanding or other superior officer; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        endeavours to seduce any person in the Military, Naval or Air Forces of Bangladesh form his duty or allegiance to the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court- martial, be liable to suffer death.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Desertion and aiding desertion</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">38. (1) Any person subject to this Act who deserts or attempts to desert the service, shall on conviction by court-martial,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">if he commits the offence on active service or when under orders for active service, be liable to suffer long imprisonment; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">if he commits the offence under any other circumstances, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person subject to this Act,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">who knowingly harbours any such deserter ; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">who being cognisant of any desertion or attempt at desertion of a person subject to this Act, does not forthwith give notice to his own or some other superior officer, or take any steps in his power to cause such person to be apprehended,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Absence without leave</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">39. Any person subject to this Act who commits any of the following offences, that is to say,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        absents himself without leave; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        without sufficient cause overstays leave granted to him; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        being on leave of absence and having received information from proper authority that any unit or detachment to which he belongs, has been ordered on active service fails, without sufficient cause, to rejoin without delay; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        without sufficient cause fails to appear at the time fixed, at the parade or place appointed for exercise or duty; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        when on parade, or on the line of march, without sufficient cause, or without leave from his superior officer, quits the parade or line of march; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         when in camp or elsewhere, is found beyond any limits fixed, or in any place prohibited by any general, local or other order without a pass or written leave from his superior officer; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        without leave from his superior officer or without due cause, absents himself from any school when duly ordered to attend there;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Striking or threatening superior officer</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">40. Any person subject to this Act who commits any of the following offences, that is to say,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        uses criminal force to, or assaults his superior officer; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        uses threatening language to such officer; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        uses insubordinate language to such officer;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial,</p><p style="text-align: justify;">if such officer is at the time in the execution of his office or, if the offence is committed on active service, be liable to suffer long imprisonment; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">in other cases, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Disobedience to superior officer</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">41. (1) Any person subject to this Act who disobeys in such manner as to show a wilful defiance of authority any lawful command given personally by his superior officer in the execution of his office whether the same is given orally or in writing or by signal or otherwise shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer long imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any person subject to this Act, who disobeys any lawful command given by his superior officer shall, on conviction by court-martial,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">if he commits such offence when on active service, be liable to suffer long imprisonment; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;">if he commits such offence when not on active service, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Insubordination and obstruction</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">42. Any person subject to this Act, who commits any of the following offences, that is to say:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        being concerned in any quarrel, affray or disorder, refuses to obey any officer, though of inferior rank, who orders him into arrest, or uses criminal force to or assaults any such officer; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        uses criminal force to, or assaults any person, whether subject to this Act or not, in whose custody he is lawfully placed, and whether he is or is not his superior officer; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        resists an escort whose duty it is to apprehend him or to have him in charge; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        breaks out of barracks, camp or quarters; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        neglects to obey any general, local or other order; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         impedes the provost-marshal or any person lawfully acting on his behalf, or when called upon, refuses to assist in the execution of his duty a provost-marshal or any person lawfully acting on his behalf; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        uses criminal force to, or assaults any person bringing provisions or supplies to the Forces;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Fraudulent enrolment</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">43. Any person subject to this Act who commits any of the following offences, that is to say:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        without having obtained a regular discharge from the Air Force or otherwise fulfilled the conditions enabling him to enrol or enter, enrols himself in, or enters the said force or any part of the Military or Naval Forces of Bangladesh; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        is concerned in the enrolment in any part of the forces of any person, when he knows or has reason to believe such person to be so circumstanced that by enrolling he commits an offence against this Act;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>False answers on enrolment</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">44. Any person having become subject to this Act who is discovered to have made at the time of enrolment a wilfully false answer to any question set forth in the prescribed form of enrolment which has been put to him by the enrolling officer before whom he appears for the purpose of being enrolled, shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Unbecoming conduct</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">45. Any officer or 26[ master warrant officer or] warrant officer who behaves in a manner unbecoming his position and the character expected of him shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to be dismissed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Certain forms of disgraceful conduct</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">46. Any person subject to this Act who commits any of the following offences, that is to say,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        is guilty of any disgraceful conduct of a cruel, indecent or unnatural kind; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        malingers, or feigns, or produces disease or infirmity in himself, or intentionally delays his cure or aggravates his disease or infirmity; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        with intent to render himself or any other person unfit for service, voluntarily causes hurt to himself or that person;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Ill- treating a subordinate</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">47. Any officer, 27[ master warrant officer,] warrant officer or non-commissioned officer, who uses criminal force to or otherwise ill-treats any person subject to this Act, being his subordinate in rank or position, shall , on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Intoxication</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">48. (1) Any person subject to this Act who is found in a state of intoxication, whether on duty or not, shall, on conviction by court-martial, if he is an officer, be liable to be dismissed; and if he is not an officer, be liable, subject to the provisions of sub-section (2), to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) When an offence of being intoxicated is committed by a person other than an officer when not on active service, or not on duty, the sentence imposed shall not exceed detention for a period of six months.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Permitting escape of person in custody</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">49. Any person subject to this Act who commits any of the following offences, that is to say:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        when in command of a guard, piquet, patrol or post, releases without proper authority, whether wilfully or without reasonable excuse any person committed to his charge or refuses to receive any prisoner or person so committed; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        wilfully or without reasonable excuse allows to escape any person who is committed to his charge, or whom it is his duty to keep or guard;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable, if he has acted wilfully, to suffer long imprisonment; and if he has not acted wilfully, to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Irregularity in connection with arrest or confinement</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">50. Any person subject to this Act, who commits any of the following offences, that is to say,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        unnecessarily detains a person in arrest or confinement without bringing him to trial, or fails to bring his case before the proper authority for investigation; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        having committed a person to Air Force custody fails without reasonable cause to deliver at the time of such committal, or as soon as practicable, and in any case within forty-eight hours thereafter, to the officer or other person into whose custody the person arrested is committed, an account in writing signed by himself of the offence with which the person so committed is charged;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Escape from custody</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">51. Any person subject to this Act who, being in lawful custody, escapes or attempts to escape, shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Offences in respect of property</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">52. Any person subject to this Act who commits any of the following offences, that is to say:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        commits theft of any property belonging to the Government, or to any Military, Naval or Air Force mess, band or institution, or to any person subject to Military, Naval or Air Force law; or serving with, or attached to, the Air Force; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        dishonestly misappropriates or converts to his own use any such property; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        commits criminal breach of trust in respect of any such property; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        dishonestly receives or retains any such property in respect of which any of the offences under clauses (a), (b) and (c) has been committed, knowing or having reason to believe the commission of such offence; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        wilfully destroys or injures any property of the Government entrusted to him; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         does any other thing with intent to defraud, or to cause wrongful gain to one person or wrongful loss to another person;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer long imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Extortion and corruption</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">53. Any person subject to this Act who commits any of the following offences, that is to say:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        commits extortion; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        without proper authority exacts from any person money, provisions or service;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Making away with equipment</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">54. Any person subject to this Act who commits any of the following offences, that is to say:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        makes away with , or is concerned in making away with, any arms, ammunition, equipment, instruments, tools, clothing or any other thing being the property of the Government issued to him for his use or entrusted to him; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        loses by neglect anything mentioned in clause (a); or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        sells, pawns, destroys or defaces any medal or decoration granted to him;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>Injury to property</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">55. Any person subject to this Act, who commits any of the following offences, that is to say:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        destroys or injures any property mentioned in clause (a) of section 54, or any property belonging to any Military, Naval or Air Force mess, band or institution, or to any person subject to Military, Naval or Air Force law, or serving with, or attached to, the Air Force; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        commits any act which causes damage to, or destruction of, any property of the Government by fire; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        kills, injures, makes away with , ill-treats or loses any animal entrusted to him;</p><p style="text-align: justify;">shall, on conviction by court-martial, be liable to suffer short imprisonment.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><b>False accusation</b></p><p style="text-align: justify;">56.
