252	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">THE TOWN IMPROVEMENT ACT, 1953 </h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>THE TOWN IMPROVEMENT ACT, 1953 </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(EAST BENGAL ACT NO. XIII OF 1953).[15th May, 1953]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">1 2 An Act to provide for the development, improvement and expansion of the 3[ Capital of the Republic and Narayanganj and Tongi  Municipalities] and certain areas in their vicinity and the constitution of a 4[ Kartripakkha] therefore.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">WHEREAS it is expedient to make provision for the development, improvement and expansion of the 5[ Capital of the Republic and Narayanganj and Tongi Municipalities] and certain areas in their vicinity by opening up congested areas, laying out or altering streets, providing open spaces for purposes of ventilation or recreation, demolishing or constructing buildings, acquiring land for the said purposes and for the re-housing of persons displaced by the execution of improvement schemes, and otherwise as hereinafter appearing;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">AND WHEREAS it is expedient that a 6[ Kartripakkha] should be constituted and invested with special powers for carrying out the objects aforesaid;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">It is hereby enacted as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>CHAPTER I</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>PRELIMINARY</strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Short title, extent and commencement</p><p style="text-align: justify;">1. (1) This Act may be called the Town Improvement Act, 1953.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) It extends to the areas comprised within the limits of the 7[ Dhaka City]; but the Government may, by notification under the procedure prescribed by section 162, extend this Act or any provision thereof to the areas comprised within the limits of the Narayanganj Municipality 8[ and Tongi Municipality] and such other area in the vicinity of 9[ the said City and] those two Municipalities as may be specified in the notification.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) It shall come into force in such areas and on such dates as the Government may, by notification, specify.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong> Definitions </strong></p><p style="text-align: justify;">2. In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">10[ (a)  “betterment fee” means the fee declared under section 94 in respect of an increase in the value of land resulting from execution of an improvement or re-housing scheme;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        “City” means the Dhaka City;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(bb) “Corporation” means the Dhaka Municipal Corporation;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        “Building Line” means a line (in the rear of a street alignment), up to which the main wall of a building abutting on a projected public street may lawfully extend;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        “Chairman” means the Chairman of the Kartripakkha;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">11[ (e) “Deputy Commissioner” includes an Additional Deputy Commissioner, and also a Upazila Nirbahi Officer or an Assistant Commissioner authorised by the Deputy Commissioner to exercise any power conferred, or to perform any duty imposed, on the Deputy Commissioner by or under this Act;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f) “Improvement Scheme” means any scheme under Chapter III, but does not include a re-housing scheme or a projected public street referred to in section 69;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">12[ (g) “Kartripakkha” means the Kartripakkha constituted under section 4;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        “member” means a member of the Kartripakkha;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(hh) “Municipality” means the Narayanganj  Municipality or the Tongi  Municipality;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         “Notification” means a notification published in the official Gazette;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">13[ (j) “Paurashava” means Narayanganj Paurashava or Tongi Paurashava;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(jj)        “prescribed” means prescribed by rules or regulations made under this Act;]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        “Secretary to the Kartripakkha” means the person for the time being appointed by the Kartripakkha, to discharge the functions of Secretary to the Kartripakkha;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(l) “Tribunal” means the Tribunal constituted under section 82;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">14[ * * *]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(n)        “drain” includes a sewer, a house-drain, a drain of any other description, a tunnel, a culvert, a ditch, a channel and any other device for carrying of sullage or rainwater;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(o)        “public street” means any street, road, lane, gally, alley, passage, pathway, square or court, whether a thoroughfare or not, over which the public have a right of way and includes-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the access or approach to a public ferry,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the roadway over any public bridge or cause-way,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the footway attached to any such street, public bridge or cause-way,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the passage connecting two public streets, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the drains attached to any such street, public bridge or cause-way, and, where there is no drain attached to any such street, shall be deemed to include also, unless the contrary is shown, all land up to the boundary wall, ail, hedge or pillar of the premises, if any, abutting on the street, or if a street alignment has been fixed, then up to such alignment;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(p)        “street alignment” means the line dividing the land comprised in and forming part of a street from the adjoining land; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">15[ (q) “Upazila Parishad” means the Upazila Parishad of a Upazila in which this Act is in force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(r)        “Union Parishad” means the Union Parishad of a Union in which this Act is in force;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(s)        “Zila Parishad” means the Zila Parishad of a district in which this Act is in force.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER II</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">THE KARTRIPAKKHA</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Constitution of the Kartripakkha</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Establishment and incorporation of Kartripakkha</p><p style="text-align: justify;">3. The duty of carrying out the provisions of this Act shall, subject to the conditions and limitations hereinafter contained, be vested in a 16[ Kartripakkha, to be called the Rajdhani Unnayan Kartripakkha; and such Kartripakkha] shall be a body corporate and have perpetual succession and a common seal, and shall by the said name sue and be sued.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Kartripakkha</p><p style="text-align: justify;">17[ 4. (1) The Kartripakkha shall consist of a Chairman and not more than five other members.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Chairman and other members shall be appointed by the Government on such terms and conditions as it may determine.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman and other members shall be the whole-time officers of the Kartripakkha.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Chairman shall be the chief executive officer of the Kartripakkha.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Chairman and other members shall exercise such powers and perform such functions as may be prescribed, or as may be assigned to them by the Government from time to time.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(6) If a vacancy occurs in the office of the Chairman or if the Chairman is unable to discharge the functions of his office on account of absence, illness or any other cause, the Government shall make such arrangement for discharging the functions of the office of Chairman as it may consider expedient.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Meetings of the Kartripakkha</p><p style="text-align: justify;">5. (1) The meetings of the Kartripakkha shall be held at such times and places as may be prescribed:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that, until so prescribed, such meetings shall be held at such times and places as may be determined by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) To constitute a quorum at a meeting of the Kartripakkha, the number of members present shall be two, if the Kartripakkha consists of not more than three members, and three, if the Kartripakkha consists of more than three members.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) All meetings of the Kartripakkha shall be presided over by the Chairman and, in his absence by a member authorised in writing by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) At a meeting of the Kartripakkha, each member shall have one vote and, in the event of equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a second or casting vote.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) No act or proceeding of the Kartripakkha shall be invalid or be called in question on the ground of any vacancy in, or any defect in the constitution of the Kartripakkha.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Conduct of Business</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Temporary association of members with the Kartripakkha for particular purposes</p><p style="text-align: justify;">21.       (1) The Kartripakkha may associate with themselves, in such manner and for such period as may be prescribed by 18[ rules or regulations] made under section 152, any person whose assistance or advice they may desire in carrying out any of the provisions of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) A person associated with themselves by the Kartripakkha under sub-section (1) for any purpose shall have a right to take part in the discussions of the Kartripakkha relative to that purpose, but shall not have a right to vote at a meeting of the Kartripakkha, and shall not be a member of the Kartripakkha for any other purpose.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">22.        [Constitution and functions of Committees.- Omitted by section 9 of the Town Improvement (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XXIX of 1987).            ]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">23.        [Meetings of Committees.- Omitted by section 9 of the Town Improvement (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XXIX of 1987).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">24. [Fees for attendance at meetings.- Omitted by section 9 of the Town Improvement (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XXIX of 1987).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">[]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">25.        [Trustees and associated members of Board or Committee not to take part in proceedings in which they are personally interested.- Omitted by section 9 of the Town Improvement (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XXIX of 1987).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to make and perform contracts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">26.       The Kartripakkha may enter into and perform all such contracts as they may consider necessary or expedient for carrying out any of the purposes of this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Execution of contracts and approval of estimates</p><p style="text-align: justify;">27.       (1) Every such contract shall be made on behalf of the Kartripakkha by the Chairman:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a contract involving an expenditure exceeding five lakhs of taka shall not be made by the Chairman without the previous sanction of the Kartripakkha.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every estimate for the expenditure of any sum for carrying out any of the purposes of this Act shall be subject to the approval of the authority who is empowered by sub-section (1) to make or sanction the making of a contract involving the expenditure of a like sum.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Sub-sections (1) and (2) shall apply to every variation or abandonment of a contract or estimate, as well as to an original contract or estimate.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Further provisions as to execution of contracts, and provision as to seal of Kartripakkha</p><p style="text-align: justify;">28.       (1) Every contract made by the Chairman on behalf of the Kartripakkha shall be entered into in such manner and form as would bind the Chairman if such contract were made on his own behalf, except that the common seal of the Kartripakkha shall be used; and every such contract may in the like manner and form be varied or discharged.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every contract for the execution of any work or the supply of any materials or goods shall be in writing and shall be sealed.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The common seal of the Kartripakkha shall remain in the custody of the Secretary to the Kartripakkha, and shall not be affixed to any contract or other instrument except in the presence of a 19[ member] (other than the Chairman), who shall attach his signature to the contract or instrument in token that the same was sealed in his presence.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The signature of the said 20[ member] shall be in addition to the signature of any witness to the execution of such contract or instrument.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) A contract not executed as provided in this section shall not be binding on the Kartripakkha.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Tenders</p><p style="text-align: justify;">29. (1) At least seven days before entering into any contract for the execution of any work or the supply of any materials or goods which will involve an expenditure not exceeding ten thousand taka, or at least fourteen days before entering into such contract involving an expenditure exceeding ten thousand taka, the Chairman shall give notice, by advertisement in local newspapers, inviting tenders for the same.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) In every case in which the acceptance of a tender would involve an expenditure exceeding five lakhs of taka, the Chairman shall submit to the Kartripakkha the specifications, conditions and estimates, and all tenders received, specifying particular tender (if any) the acceptance of which he recommends.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Kartripakkha shall not be bound to sanction the acceptance of any tender which has been made; but it may sanction the acceptance of any such tender which appears to them, in consideration of all circumstances, to be the most advantageous, or may direct the rejection of all the tenders submitted to them.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Security for performance of contracts</p><p style="text-align: justify;">30.       The Chairman shall take sufficient security for the due performance of every contract involving an expenditure exceeding one thousand taka.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Supply of documents and information to the Government</p><p style="text-align: justify;">31.       (1) The Chairman shall forward to the Government a copy of the minutes of the proceeding of each meeting of the Kartripakkha, within ten days from the date on which the minutes of the proceedings of such meeting were signed as 21[ * * *].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">22[ (1A) If, in the opinion of the Chairman, any resolution passed by the Kartripakkha is not in conformity with law, or is, in any way, against public interest, the Chairman shall, while forwarding a copy thereof, bring this fact to the notice of the Government making his own suggestion for requisite action in the matter. Till orders are received from the Government, the execution of the resolution shall be held in abeyance.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the Government so directs in any case, the Chairman shall forward to it a copy of all papers which were laid before the Kartripakkha for consideration at any meeting.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may require the Chairman to furnish it with-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        any return, statement, estimate, statistics or other information regarding any matter under the control of the Kartripakkha, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        a report on any such matter, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        a copy of any document in the charge of the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Government may, at any time, cause an investigation to be made, by an officer appointed in this behalf, into the affairs of the Kartripakkha and take such remedial measures as may be warranted by the findings of such investigation.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Employees of the Kartripakkha</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Statement of strength and remuneration of staff</p><p style="text-align: justify;">32.       The Kartripakkha shall, from time to time prepare, and shall maintain, a statement showing-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the number, designations and grades of the employees (other than employees who are paid by the day or whose pay is charged to temporary work) whom they consider it necessary and proper to employ for the purposes of this Act,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the amount and nature of the salary, fees and allowances to be paid to each such employee, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the contribution payable under section 160 in respect of each such employee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Kartripakkha to make 23[ regulations]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">33.       The Kartripakkha shall from time to time make 24[ regulations]-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        fixing the amount and nature of the security to be furnished by any employee of the Kartripakkha from whom it may be deemed expedient to require security;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        for regulating the grant of leave of absence, leave allowances and acting allowances to the employees of the Kartripakkha; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        for establishing and maintaining a provident or annuity fund, for compelling all or any of the employees of the Kartripakkha (other than any servant of the Government in respect of whom a contribution is paid under section 160) to contribute to such fund, at such rates and subject to such conditions as may be prescribed by such 25[ regulations], and for supplementing such contributions out of the funds of the Kartripakkha:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided that a servant of the Government shall not be entitled to leave or leave allowances otherwise than as may be prescribed by the conditions of his service under the Government relating to transfer to foreign service.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power of creation of posts for the Kartripakkha</p><p style="text-align: justify;">34. (1) Subject to the provisions of this Act, the Kartripakkha may determine, from time to time, what officers and other employees are necessary for the performance of its functions, may also engage such experts and consultants, as it may consider necessary for the said purpose, and may fix the salaries, fees and allowances to be paid to such officers, employees, experts and consultants:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">26[ Provided that prior approval of the Government shall be necessary for creation of posts carrying pay in a scale above the Modified New Scales of Pay of Tk. 2800-4425:]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided further that the creation of any post shall be subject to specific provision being made in the approved budget in that behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Kartripakkha shall be liable to pay such contribution for leave allowance and pension of any servant of the Government employed as Chairman or an employee of the Kartripakkha, as may be required by the condition of his service under the Government, as the case may be, to be paid by him or on his behalf.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">27[ ]</p><p style="text-align: justify;">35. [Power of appointment, punishment, etc.- Omitted by section 13 of the Town Improvement (Amendment) Act, 1987 (Act No. XXIX of 1987).]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Controls by Chairman</p><p style="text-align: justify;">36.       The Chairman shall exercise supervision and control over the acts and proceedings of all employees of the Kartripakkha; and, subject to the foregoing sections, shall dispose of all questions relating to the service of the said employees and their pay, privileges and allowances.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Delegation of certain functions of Chairman</p><p style="text-align: justify;">37. 28[ (1) The Chairman may, by general or special order in writing, delegate to any member or officer of the Kartripakkha any of the Chairman’s powers, duties or functions under this Act or any rule or regulation made thereunder except those conferred or imposed upon or vested in him by sections 27, 29 and 31.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The exercise or discharge of any powers, duties or functions delegated under sub-section (1) shall be subject to such conditions and limitations if any, as may be prescribed in the said order, and also to control and revision by the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">CHAPTER III</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">IMPROVEMENT SCHEMES AND RE-HOUSING SCHEMES</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">When improvement scheme may be framed</p><p style="text-align: justify;">38.       Whenever it appears to the Kartripakkha, whether upon an official representation made under section 43 or without such a representation,-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        that any buildings in any area which are used or are intended to be used as dwelling places, are unfit for human habitation, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        that danger to the health of the inhabitants of buildings in any area, or in the neighbouring buildings, is caused by-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the narrowness, closeness and bad arrangement and condition of streets or buildings or groups of buildings in such area, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        the want of light, air, ventilation or proper conveniences in such area, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       any other sanitary defects in such area, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        that for the purpose of-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         providing building sites, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        developing and improving any area, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       remedying defective ventilation, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       creating new, or improving existing, means of communication and facilities for traffic, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(v)        affording better facilities for conservancy,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">it is expedient to lay out new streets or to alter existing streets (including bridges, culverts and cause-ways), or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        that it is necessary to provide in any area, parks, open spaces, playgrounds or similar amenities, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e) that it is expedient and for the public advantage to provide-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         housing accommodation, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        buildings for public use and convenience, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iii)       an adequate water-supply, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(iv)       a drainage, and sewerage scheme,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">the Kartripakkha may pass a resolution to that effect and may then proceed to frame an improvement scheme.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Matters to be considered when framing improvement schemes</p><p style="text-align: justify;">39.       When framing an improvement scheme in respect of any area, regard shall be had to-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the nature and conditions of neighbouring areas and of the Dacca  City as a whole;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the several directions in which the expansion of the Dacca  City appears likely to take place; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the likelihood of improvement schemes being required for other parts of the Dacca  City.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Matters to be provided for improvement schemes</p><p style="text-align: justify;">40.       An improvement scheme may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the acquisition by the Kartripakkha of any land, in the area comprised in the scheme, which will, in their opinion, be required for the execution of the scheme or be affected by the execution of the scheme;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the laying out or re-laying out of the land in the said area;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        such demolition, alteration or reconstruction of buildings situated on land which it is proposed to acquire in the said area, as the Kartripakkha may think necessary;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        the construction of any buildings which the Kartripakkha may consider it necessary to erect for any purpose other than sale;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        the laying out or alteration of streets (including bridges, cause-ways and culverts);</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         the levelling, paving, metalling, flagging, channelling, sewering and draining of the said streets and the provisions therein of water, lighting and other sanitary conveniences ordinarily provided in a City or Municipality;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(g)        the raising, lowering or levelling of any land in the area comprised in the scheme;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(h)        the formation, retention or enlargement of open spaces;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the augmentation of the present water-supply, or any other scheme for the improvement of the water-supply;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(j)         the making of a drainage and sewerage scheme including outfall works; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(k)        any other matters consistent with this Act which the Kartripakkha may think fit.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Discontinuance of use of land and alteration or removal of building, etc</p><p style="text-align: justify;">41. Whenever it appears to the Kartripakkha that it is expedient in the interests of the public and for the proper planning of the area included in any improvement scheme-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        that any use of land should be discontinued, or that any conditions should be imposed on the continuance thereof; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        that any building or works or factory should be altered or removed,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">the Kartripakkha may pass a resolution to the effect and such resolution shall form part of the particulars of the scheme under clause (c) of sub-section (1) of section 45.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Re-housing of persons displaced by improvement schemes</p><p style="text-align: justify;">42.       The Kartripakkha may frame schemes (herein called re-housing schemes) for the construction, maintenance and management of such and so many dwellings and shops as they may consider ought to be provided for persons of the poorer and working classes who-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        are displaced by the execution of any improvement scheme sanctioned under this Act; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        are likely to be displaced by the execution of any improvement scheme which it is intended to frame, or to submit to the Government for sanction under this Act.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Authority for making an official representation for a general improvement schemes</p><p style="text-align: justify;">43.       (1) An official representation referred to in section 38 may be made by the Corporation or Paurashava-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) of its own motion; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        on a written complaint by the Health Officer of the Corporation or Paurashava; or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c) in respect of any area comprised in a municipal ward- on a written complaint signed by twenty-five or more residents of such ward who are liable to pay any tax assessed upon the annual value of buildings and, lands leviable under the 29[ Paurashava Ordinance, 1977 (XXVI of 1977)].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the Corporation or Paurashava decide not to make an official representation on any complaint made to them under clause (b) or clause (c) of sub-section (1), they shall cause a copy of such complaint to be sent to the Kartripakkha, with a statement of the reasons for their decision.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Consideration of official representations</p><p style="text-align: justify;">44.       (1) The Kartripakkha shall consider every official representation made under section 43, and, if satisfied as to the truth thereof and to the sufficiency of their resources, shall decide whether an improvement scheme to carry such representation into effect should be framed forthwith or not, and shall forthwith intimate their decision to the Corporation or Paurashava.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) If the Kartripakkha decide that it is not necessary or expedient to frame an improvement scheme forthwith, they shall inform the Corporation or Paurashava of the reasons for their decision.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) If the Kartripakkha fail, for a period of six months after the receipt of any official representation made under section 43, to intimate their decision thereon to the Corporation or Paurashava,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">or if the Kartripakkha intimate to the Corporation or Paurashava their decision that it is not necessary or expedient to frame an improvement scheme forthwith,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">the Corporation or Paurashava may, if they think fit, refer the matter to the Government.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) The Government shall consider every reference made to it under sub-section (3), and-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        if it considers that the Kartripakkha ought, under all the circumstances, to have passed a decision within the period mentioned in sub-section (3), shall direct the Kartripakkha to pass a decision within such further period as the Government may think reasonable, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        if it considers that it is, under all the circumstances expedient that an improvement scheme should forthwith be framed, shall direct the Kartripakkha to proceed forthwith to frame an improvement scheme.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The Kartripakkha shall comply with every direction given by the Government under sub-section (4).</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Preparation, publication and transmission of notice as to improvement schemes and supply of documents to applicants</p><p style="text-align: justify;">45.       (1) When for any area within the City or Municipality any improvement scheme or re-housing scheme has been framed, the Kartripakkha shall prepare a notice, stating-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        the fact that the scheme has been framed,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the boundaries of the area comprised in the scheme, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        the place at which particulars of the scheme, a map of the area comprised in the scheme, and a statement of the land which it is proposed to acquire and of the land in regard to which it is proposed to recover a betterment fee, may be seen at reasonable hours.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The Kartripakkha shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         cause the said notice to be published weekly for three consecutive weeks in the official Gazette and in local newspapers, with a statement of the period within which objections will be received, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        send a copy of the notice to the 30[ Mayor of the Corporation or Chairman of the Paurashava].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Chairman shall cause copies of all documents referred to in clause (c) of sub-section (1) to be delivered to any applicant on payment of such fee as may be prescribed by rule made under section 152.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transmission to Kartripakkha of representation by Corporation or Paurashava</p><p style="text-align: justify;">46.       The 31[ Mayor of the Corporation or Chairman of the Paurashava] to whom a copy of the notice has been sent under clause (ii) of sub-section (2) of section 45 shall, within a period of thirty days from the receipt of the said copy, forward to the Kartripakkha any representation which the Corporation or Paurashava may think fit to make with regard to the scheme.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Furnishing list of persons and copy of, or extract from, assessment list</p><p style="text-align: justify;">47.       As soon as possible after the publication of a notice under section 45, the Chairman shall send a statement containing the particulars of the land which it is proposed to acquire in executing the scheme or in regard to which it is proposed to recover a betterment fee, to the 32[ Mayor of the Corporation or Chairman of the Paurashava], in which any portion</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">of the area comprised in the scheme is situated, with a request to furnish-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i) a list of the names and addresses of the persons whose lands are likely to be acquired for, or affected by, the execution of the scheme, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii) a copy of or extract from the municipal assessment list,</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">within fourteen days of the receipt of such request and on payment of prescribed fee.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Service of notice as to proposed acquisition of land or recovery of betterment fee</p><p style="text-align: justify;">48.        (1) During the thirty days next following the first day on which any notice is published under section 45 in respect of any improvement scheme or re-housing scheme, the Kartripakkha shall serve a notice on-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        every person whose name appears in the municipal assessment list or in the list referred to in item (i) of section 47, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        the occupier (who need not be named) of each premises entered in the municipal assessment list which the Kartripakkha proposes to acquire in executing the scheme.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Such notice shall-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        state that the Kartripakkha propose to acquire the land referred to in section 47 or to recover a betterment fee for the purpose of carrying out an improvement scheme or a re-housing scheme, and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        require such person, if he dissents from such acquisition or from the recovery of such betterment fee, to state his reasons in writing within a period of thirty days from the service of the notice.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Every such notice shall be signed by or by the order of the Chairman.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Abandonment of improvement scheme, or application to Government to sanction it</p><p style="text-align: justify;">49.       (1) After the expiry of the periods respectively prescribed under clause (i) of sub-section (2) of section 45, and by section 46, and clause (b) of sub-section (2) of section 48 in respect of any improvement scheme or re-housing scheme, the Kartripakkha shall consider any objection, representation and statement of dissent received thereunder, and after hearing all Abandonment of improvement scheme, or application to Government to sanction it</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">persons making any such objection, representation or dissent who may desire to be heard, the Kartripakkha may either abandon the scheme or apply to the Government for sanction to the scheme, with such modifications (if any), as the Kartripakkha may consider necessary.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Every application submitted under sub-section (1) shall be accompanied by-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        a description of, and full particulars relating to, the scheme, and complete plans and estimates of the cost of executing the scheme;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        a statement of the reasons for any modifications made in the scheme as originally framed;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        a statement of objections (if any), received under section 45;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(d)        any representation received under section 46;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(e)        a list of the names of all persons (if any) who have dissented, under clause (b) of sub-section (2) of section 48 from the proposed acquisition of their land or from the proposed recovery of a betterment fee and a statement of the reasons given for such dissent; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(f)         a statement of the arrangements made or proposed by the Kartripakkha for the re-housing of persons of the poorer and working classes who are likely to be displaced by the execution of the scheme.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Power to sanction or reject improvement scheme</p><p style="text-align: justify;">50.       The Government may sanction, either with or without modification, or may refuse to sanction, any improvement scheme or re-housing scheme submitted to it under section 49.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Notification of sanction to improvement scheme</p><p style="text-align: justify;">51.       (1) Whenever the Government sanctions an improvement scheme or re-housing scheme, it shall announce the fact by notification, and the Kartripakkha shall forthwith proceed to execute the scheme.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The publication of a notification under sub-section (1), in respect of any scheme, shall be conclusive evidence that the scheme has been duly framed and sanctioned.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">33[ 51A. (1) When any improvement or re-housing scheme or re-building scheme has been framed for execution in any area outside the City or Municipality, the provisions of sections 45 to 51 shall not apply.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Sanction to improvement scheme of Taka 5 Lakhs or more outside the 34[ City or Municipal] limit</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Any improvement or re-housing scheme or re-building scheme proposed to be executed in an area outside 35[ City or Municipal] limits and estimated to cost Taka five lakhs or more framed by the Kartripakkha, shall be submitted to Government for sanction.</p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) The Government may sanction such improvement or re-housing or re-building scheme either with or without modification, or may refuse to sanction but in either case it shall communicate its decision to the Kartripakkha within sixty days from the date of receipt of the scheme from the Kartripakkha.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Whenever the Government sanctions, with or without modifications any improvement or re-housing scheme, or re-building scheme outside the 36[ City or Municipal] limits it shall announce the fact by a notification, and the Kartripakkha shall forthwith proceed to execute the scheme.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) The publication of a notification under sub-section (4) in respect of any scheme outside the 37[ City or Municipal] area shall be conclusive evidence that the scheme has been duly framed and sanctioned.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Savings</p><p style="text-align: justify;">51B. The provisions of sections 45 to 51 of the Act shall not apply to any scheme inside the City or Municipality estimated to cost less than Taka five lakhs.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Improvement scheme of less than Taka 5 lakhs either within or outside the City or Municipality</p><p style="text-align: justify;">51C. (1) Whenever the Kartripakkha frames any improvement scheme or re-housing scheme or re-building scheme of the value of less than Taka five lakhs for execution within or outside the 38[ City or Municipal] area it shall announce the fact by a notification and shall forthwith proceed to execute the same.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) The publication of a notification under sub-section (1) in respect of any scheme either within or outside the 39[ City or Municipal] area shall be conclusive evidence that the scheme has been duly framed.]</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Alteration of improvement scheme after sanction</p><p style="text-align: justify;">52.       At any time after any improvement scheme or re-housing scheme has been sanctioned by the Government and before it has been carried into execution, the Kartripakkha may alter it:</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        if any alteration is estimated to increase the estimated net cost of executing a scheme by more than five per cent of such cost, such alteration shall not be made without the previous sanction of the Government;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        if any alteration involves the acquisition, otherwise than by agreement, of any land the acquisition of which has not been sanctioned by the Government, the procedure prescribed in the foregoing sections of this Chapter shall, so far as applicable, be followed, as if the alteration were a separate scheme;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(c)        if owing to the changes made, in the course of a scheme, any land not previously liable under the scheme to the payment of a betterment fee, becomes liable to such payment, the provisions of sections 45, 48 and 49 shall, so far as they are applicable, be followed in any such case.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Combination of improvement scheme</p><p style="text-align: justify;">53.       Any number of areas in respect of which improvement schemes or re-housing schemes have been, or are proposed to be, framed, may, at any time, be included in one combined scheme.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Width of streets</p><p style="text-align: justify;">54.       No   street laid out or altered by the Kartripakkha shall be of less width than-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a)        forty feet, if the street be intended for vehicular traffic, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        twenty feet, if the street be intended for pedestrian traffic only;</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Provided as follows:-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(i)         the width of an existing street need not be increased to the minimum required by this section, if the Kartripakkha consider it impracticable to do so; and</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(ii)        nothing in this section shall be deemed to prevent the Kartripakkha from laying out service passages for sanitary purposes of any width less than twenty feet.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">Transfer to Kartripakkha, for purposes of improvement scheme, of building or land vested in a Corporation or Paurashava, Zilla Parishad, Upazila Parishad or Union Parishad</p><p style="text-align: justify;">55. (1) Whenever any building, or any street, square or other land, or any part thereof, which-</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(a) is situated in the City or Municipality and is vested in the Corporation or Paurashava, or</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(b)        is situated in any area outside the City or Municipality, in which this Act is, for the time being, in force, and is vested in a 40[ Zilla Parishad, Upazila Parishad or Union Parishad], is within the area of any improvement scheme or re-housing scheme or is required for the purpose of such scheme, the Kartripakkha shall give notice accordingly to the 41[ Mayor of the Corporation or Chairman of the Paurashava, Zilla Parishad, Upazila Parishad or Union Parishad], as the case may be, and such building, street, square, other land or part shall thereupon vest in the Kartripakkha.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(2) Where any street or square, or any part thereof vests in the Kartripakkha under sub-section (1), no compensation shall be payable by the Kartripakkha to the Corporation or Paurashava or the 42[ Zilla Parishad, Upazila Parishad or Union Parishad] in respect of such street, square or part.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(3) Where any land, not being a street or square, vests in the Kartripakkha under sub-section (1), compensation in respect of such land shall not be payable by the Kartripakkha except to the 43[ Zilla Parshad, Upazila Parishad or Union Parishad].</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(4) Where any building vests in the Kartripakkha under sub-section (1), compensation for such building shall be payable by the Kartripakkha to the Corporation or Paurashava or the 44[ Zilla Parishad, Upazila Parishad or Union Parishad], as the case may be.</p><p style="text-align: justify;"></p><p style="text-align: justify;">(5) If any question or dispute arises-</p><p popular-posts=""
